title.narrative: 1. Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICE DELIVERY

description.narrative: By 2020, technical departments have strengthened capacities to provide improved services for potable water, hygiene and sanitation in rural areas., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children living in rural areas have improved access to quality water, a healthy environment and sustainable sanitation facilities in communities, in schools, and at health centres.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, technical departments have strengthened capacities to provide improved services for potable water, hygiene and sanitation in rural areas.

description.narrative: During the first semester of 2020, UNICEF Burkina Faso country office (BCO) constructed 89 water points and rehabilitated 124 water points in the regions of Boucle de Mouhoun, Sahel, Centre-Ouest, Est, Plateau-Central benefitting 63,900 people (33,228 women). The BCO contributed at increasing WASH coverage with the construction of water points in 106 new schools and 2 health care facilities (HCFs), and 482 gender-segregated latrines in 76 schools. As a result, approximately 26,500 school children (13,780 girls) have access to clean drinking water and toilets. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:30/06/2020
